page.title: 10WILDERHOPE MANOR
page.content: In a commanding position overlooking Hope Dale,a remote and unspoiled Shropshire valley,Wilderhope Manor has stood the test of time,and looks much as it did when first built in the late 1500's.Wilderhope is built of the local Aymestry limestone,though the tall chimney stacks,which are so notable a feature of its silouette seen from across the valley,are of beautifully executed brickwork.The house was carefully restored in the 1930's by the National Trust and is now a bustling Youth Hostel;an historic setting for modern activities There was another restoration programme in 1975 and this again did not alter the character of the house. It remains the most imposing building in the area,full of interesting architectural details and tales of the past.
